text: [Music]
hey guys it's angel today I'm going to
show you how to make a delicious
Taiwanese breakfast it's a taiwanese
specialty called bad thing now something
literally translates to egg pancake and
they're super savory easy to make and in
fact last time I was in Taipei I had
done big for breakfast and it was only
about 30 and tea which I think with the
exchange rate is about $1 u.s. so super
inexpensive if you go back to Taiwan but
of course if you can't go back to Taiwan
these are super easy to make it helped
so keep watching now for the ingredients
the first thing we're gonna need are
some green onion pancakes now if you
like to make your green onion pancakes
from scratch I have a really good recipe
for that I'll post in the video
description below or you could always
buy frozen green onion pancakes from
your local grocery store now if you're
wondering what it looks like I have a
bag right here this is the lnw brand and
they call them green onion flat cakes
but take a look there's a lot of
different brands out there just pick one
that you really like next we're gonna
need 2 eggs 1 tablespoon of water and
finally some optional soy sauce and
green onions for garnish now let's get
cooking
pre-heat a nonstick pan over medium heat
then add 1 tbsp of oil before adding the
green onion pancake we'll want to pan
fry each side of the pancake for 2 to 3
minutes or until just cooked and lightly
Brown
once that's done remove the pancake and
set aside on a plate next in a small
bowl I'm going to beat together 2 eggs
along with 1 tablespoon of water adding
the water lightens the eggs and makes
them fluffier then in the same non-stick
pan we used earlier add some oil
followed by the egg mixture and give the
pan a slight swirl to spread into a
crepe shape at this time you can feel
free to incorporate some chopped green
onions and some salt and pepper to taste
after letting it cook for about 15
seconds gently place the pancake over
the egg now depending on the size of
your pan and how much egg mixture you
have the egg might be bigger than our
pancake I know it looks weird but that's
totally cool because for me
it's just more goodies to eat then let
that cook for another minute or so or
until done and flip one more time so the
egg is facing up now you can go ahead to
turn off the heat carefully roll the
pancake into a tube shape and then
transfer to a cutting board to cut into
smaller pieces finally you can top it
off with some light soy sauce and some
more green onions and that guys is how
you make Taiwanese egg pancakes or
something now let's get a close-up of
the food and taste test look at that
it's so flaky mmm
that was so so good so now you have the
recipe to one my favorite tab one is
breakfast and now it's your turn
I want to know what's your favorite
Asian breakfast post in the comments
below and let me know and I might just
pick it from my next recipe video until
then take care and I will see you guys
in the next one bye for now
you
[Music]
